title: Haiwang Yuan on Yuan Dynasty Secondary Q1

content.question: Which piece of evidence from the passage would best support the argument that the Mongols contributed to the integration of cultures across Eurasia by the end of the thirteenth century?

choices.label: Khubilai Khan established his dynastyâ€™s capital on the site of present-day Beijing.
Turks, Uighurs, and Persians served in high-level positions in the Yuan bureaucracy.
Some Chinese opposed Mongol rule and the appointment of foreign Yuan officials.
Some Chinese opposed having Muslim and Tibetan officials at the Mongol court.

content.answer: Turks, Uighurs, and Persians served in high-level positions in the Yuan bureaucracy.

topic.text: 2.2: The Mongol Empire and the Making of the Modern World

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
